item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 17, 2024 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. The decline and fall of the British economy (53 points | 35 comments)
2. CSS gets a new logo and it uses the color `rebeccapurple` (273 points | 35 comments)
3. The Bluesky firehose viewed in the style of a Windows XP screensaver (212 points | 57 comments)
4. James Gleick's Chaos: The Software (120 points | 9 comments)
5. All-in-one embedding model for interleaved text, images, and screenshots (4 points | discuss)
6. King Arthur's ancient trail across Britain (14 points | 4 comments)
7. Teach yourself to echolocate (129 points | 29 comments)
8. Show HN: I built a(nother) house optimized for LAN parties (588 points | 226 comments)
9. SICP: The only computer science book worth reading twice? (2010) (307 points | 119 comments)
10. Effect of a giant meteorite impact on Paleoarchean environment and life (105 points | 40 comments)
11. Two galaxies aligned in a way where their gravity acts as a compound lens (210 points | 62 comments)
12. James Webb Space Telescope finds evidence for alternate theory of gravity (269 points | 112 comments)
13. My Kidney Donation (5 points | discuss)
14. Appreciation of the mark-all-as-read button (22 points | 8 comments)
15. Logica – Declarative logic programming language for data (117 points | 43 comments)
16. Xogot – Godot for iPad (67 points | 13 comments)
17. Statistical Rethinking (2024 Edition) (126 points | 22 comments)
18. Yggdrasil Network (258 points | 90 comments)
19. When Abstractions Break (10 points | 1 comment)
20. I tried every top email marketing tool (162 points | 80 comments)
21. Discord API Errors (26 points | 11 comments)
22. One-parting some Commodore 64 utilities for fun and profit (13 points | 1 comment)
23. Resolving a mysterious problem with find (13 points | 8 comments)
24. SmoothLLM: Defending Large Language Models Against Jailbreaking Attacks (35 points | 11 comments)
25. Two Nobel Prize winners want to cancel their own CRISPR patents in Europe (57 points | 22 comments)
26. Numpyro: Probabilistic programming with NumPy powered by Jax (86 points | 19 comments)
27. Optimizers: The Low-Key MVP (99 points | 7 comments)
28. Don't Look Twice: Faster Video Transformers with Run-Length Tokenization (59 points | 9 comments)
29. JavaScript dos and donts Mu-An Chiou (43 points | 21 comments)
30. Safety in an unsafe world (53 points | 17 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 17, 2024 at 8:20 AM UTC
